titleStmt.title: By the King. A proclamation. James R. Whereas we have been informed that several of the inhabitants of the counties adjacent to this our city of Dublin have forborn to bring such quantities of corn, straw, coals, turf, wood, or other firing to the said city, ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1685-1688 : James II)
James II, King of England, 1633-1701.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Andrew Crook the assign of Benjamin Tooke printer to the King's most excellent Majesty; and are to be sold at his Majesties printing-house on Ormonde-Key,

notesStmt.note: Title from caption title and opening lines of text.
"Given at our court at Dublin-Castle the 29th day of November 1689."
For the bringing in of corn, straw, colas, wood, and turf to Dublin. Cf. Steele.
Steele notation: Inhabi- Wood as; Arms 189.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
